Constantly talked about himself during lecture and 99% of the time it wasn't relevant (lowkey saviour complex). It's obvious there's no planning done in advanced because he reads the slides and makes something up. 
Exam wasn't challenging if you study using the textbook, lectures are useless. You don't receive any grades until the end of term.

Richard was a fun lecturer for this course, although at times it seemed like he would trail off on some tangents rather than lecturing on the slides. The textbook is your best friend for studying in this class.

Curt's lectures were very enjoyable with all the guest lecturers. Get ready to write very long papers for this course but they are take home! The questions for the papers are clear and the TA was approachable for re-grading. The class however did seem disorganized with the TA dropping out of the course and the professor not responding to emails.

Dr. Griffiths is a fantastic professor. He's super kind and very approachable. You can chat with him about course content, and he's more than happy to explain things and discuss his research. If you can take a course with him, DEFINITELY DO! In my opinion, he's one of the best Crim professors at SFU - do yourself a favour and take a course with him

I took policing in Canada with Curt. He was a nice prof but the course consisted of primarily presentations from different members of law enforcement so I did not get to see him teach. We had two take-home exams as well as a tutorial presentation, responding in tutorials, and general participation. Pretty chill and was interesting.

By far one of the greatest professors at SFU. He is the only professor I've met that will make an effort to go up to his students during breaks and ask them about their semester and interest in the class. Genuinely compassionate individual with a lot of knowledge. Brings in lots of guest lecturers which made the course even more amazing.

although the lectures are dry, most of the content is very straightforward and since this is the first time she's teaching the course, everything is very clear. the midterm was mostly from her lecture content so read the slides. there is a presentation in the tutorial
